website_summaries.verdict: Its superior quality, rugged performance, and versatile fun earn it the top spot on our shortlist.
pros: Stands out for its large front no-flat wheel and back casters for 360-degree spinning
Steel frame is built to last
cons: It's not adjustable, but it is still easy for most kids to ride

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and durable like razor scooters
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and durable like razor scooters. This is definitely a toy to spin and screw around on. It’s not like a big wheel where your kid can go around the block with your or follow the bigger kids on bikes. The back wheels always spin and even when trying to go straight the tail end swings around. They will have fun, but only as long as they like spinning out as they won’t have fun trying to get from point A to point B on it.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeShoppers

customer_reviews.title: This is a super fun bike (yes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike for my daughter for Christmas after she rode one that belong to a neighbor. This is a super fun bike (yes, as an adult female who is 5'4", I have driven this bicycle a few times. :-). It rides super smooth and spins fast. The position low to the ground makes it stable enough it will not tip over. My 3 year old is a little to short to drive it yet, but my 5 year old daughter rides this daily and all the neighborhood kids beg to ride it as well. I will be purchasing a second one for my son as soon as he is tall enough to reach the pedals.
customer_reviews.author: BamaJess

customer_reviews.title: 2 activities for the price of 1!
customer_reviews.text: Great fun for the grandkids! Added bonus, they were easy enough to assemble that my 9 and 10 year old grandsons put them together themselves with minimal help from me, including reading the directions, so we got a free STEM activity too. Took them about an hour, would probably take an adult 20-30 minutes. They LOVE riding the finished trikes!
customer_reviews.author: teachergrammy

customer_reviews.title: All the kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: The neighborhood boys all have one of these. They're a very popular toy and all the kids want to ride them. We bought our son one for his 7th birthday and he was so exited to have his own. He can reach the pedals just fine. My almost 5 year old likes to ride it too and just barely reaches the pedals. My husband decided to take the razor apart and paint it so we could easily tell which one belonged to our son since so many kids already had them. The green and blue look great!
customer_reviews.author: FamilyOf4

customer_reviews.title: My grandson and neighborhood kids love this trike
customer_reviews.text: This is my grandson's second Razor trike. The seat on the first one disintegrated and I couldn't find a replacement seat. I bought this for him and he thinks it's even faster than his last one. He is 8 and tall for his age (as big as the 10 year olds, he plays with). They all ride this trike and love it, just like the last one. They all have bikes that go faster, but they really enjoy these things. His last Razor trike lasted 3 years of hard and steady use by multiple kids before the seat broke. So, I hope this one lasts at least that long. I think it's a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Rainy Day Reader

customer_reviews.title: Favorite birthday gift!
customer_reviews.text: My 7-year-old grandson loves it. He caught on very quickly to the quirky movements of the tike. You would have thought he was on a roller coaster with all the hoots, hollers and screams. He had more fun than you can believe. Well worth the price. It is well made and easy to assemble. All the tools you will need are included. Read the instructions closely and follow the safety rules regarding a helmet, supervision, not going on inclined surfaces or the road, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: We got this trike in 2013! I am now writing a review in 2019. We have had 3 kids use it and have moved internationally twice and they still seem to find it fun!
customer_reviews.author: dcn312

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: My son loves to ride this thing all over. I thought he would get tired of it quick but he still enjoys to take it for a spin. After 6 months it has held up to street riding well. You must watch kids around driveways and cars. This thing is really low to the ground. It's only good in wide flat concrete surfaces or streets. It should come with a flag in my opinion. That's the reason for the 4 stars. Went together with not too much difficulty. And the kids have a blast. I do recommend it but it should come with a flag on a pole.
customer_reviews.author: Big Paulie

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Fun
customer_reviews.text: We've owned this for over a year and it shows no sign of slowing down. The neighbor kids borrow it often and love it too; even they can't tear it up (and that's a miracle!). It's fun but not dangerous; the level of out-of-control can be controlled and its fun to learn. This is big money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: TweedBunny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Our grandchildren recently had the opportunity to play on the Razor RipRider at a friends house. They loved it and had a ball. I purchased two of them. They did require some assembly but it was very easy. All of the bolts are in place, you just need to remove them, put the pieces together and reinsert the bolts. Very high quality construction, mostly steel except for the seat, peddles and wheels. Our basement floor will make a great place to ride the RipRiders!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have Toy for all kids!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing toy. My 2 boys (11 and 13) have owned these for many, many years. They have held up amazingly. Whenever kids come over, it is always the go to toy. Even as teenagers, they can't get enough of the ripriders. I just purchased 2 for my nephews (5 and 6 year olds). I am sure they will get the same use out of them. They couldn't be put together fast enough!
customer_reviews.author: MommyV

customer_reviews.title: Mom of 5 boys approves!
customer_reviews.text: 5 boys later and we are HUGE fans of Razor products from their electric dirt bikes and electric scooters to bikes, kick scooters and now this awesome rip rider! My 7yr old was quite pleased to open this up for his bday and his other brothers (11yr 6yr and next in-line 3yr have all taken their turns.. I’m sure the baby will give it a go as soon as he can walk himself over to it!) it really wings them around-like a souped up big wheel! Glides easily and is easy to pedal! Honestly thinking of buying another one for this, rowdy-rough-tough-destroyers of all things nice, herd!
customer_reviews.author: PicklesAndPitmans13

customer_reviews.title: Grandkids love them!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for our grandkids, ages 7 & 10. They absolutely love them and think they’re so cool, the way they drift. They can be ridden down the sidewalk, however we use extra care when going by parked cars because of the drifting. Are great fun on large patios. These Riftriders are sturdy, and all in all have exceeded our expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Bitsy57

customer_reviews.title: My 5 year old LOVES IT!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the favorite gift if my sons 5 year old party. It was worth every penny, as every kid at the party road and played with it for hours. He is average height and had no trouble reaching the peddles.
customer_reviews.author: Extatic Mama

customer_reviews.title: Where were these toys when I was growing up?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 5 year old. Can't say enough great things about it. She's still a little short for it, so we wedge a pillow behind her back and off she goes. She loves doing spinouts on this, and it looks so fun. Can't say enough great things about Razor products.
customer_reviews.author: SBell

customer_reviews.title: Cool bike, but beware it you have younger kids ...
customer_reviews.text: Cool bike, but beware it you have younger kids riding this bike. The back wheels tend to make the bike swing out when going on an incline, like a driveway, which may cause your kid to inadvertently roll into the street, which is obviously dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Max H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome drifter!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 years ago. Its still going strong. Its well built. And fun!! We use it mostly indoors. If we used on street. Im sure after 2 yrs we would have needed new wheels. But if you use indoors or in tennis courts, it will last a very long time
customer_reviews.author: Dennis H.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble and it seems very sturdy. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is because the front tire is hard plastic instead of rubber. Other than that we liked it so much we bought another one.
customer_reviews.author: Cinderlori

customer_reviews.title: Daughter Loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter who is 7, but more the size of an average 10 year old, saved up to buy this razor trike. She’s on it pretty much daily and loves it. It does have a creaking sound as she leans into turns after a few months use, but it doesn’t seem to be breaking or anything like that
customer_reviews.author: JLeggette

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - huge hit for birthday present!
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for his birthday and can’t get enough of it. In fact, the neighbors were all asking where I got it and got them for their kids for Christmas. We live in a cul-de-sac and all the kids ride and spin on them. Perfect gift! They are all 6-8 and love it. Even one of the older kids got the big kid version, although that one doesn’t spin around the same.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Kids can't get enough, friend love too, awsome product
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it, had it for 6 months now. My 2 year old up to 10 year old rides it. Good for beginner bike riders and pros. Harder to ride on rough roads due to small back tires. Great for concrete and smooth roads. Pros: Unique riding for kids, easy to learn, hasn't gotten old yet, durable bike, built reasonably well, easy to assemble Cons: Plastic front detail below handlebars broke second day of hard used (does not affect function of bike). Would give 5 starts if part did not break. Would purchase again, great buy, good price.
customer_reviews.author: Jaga D

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We now have two of these. While my boys love then we’ve only had them a week and pieces keep falling off. The first one was just the front plate which isn’t necessary and I just need to find spare tiny screws to get it back on. However with the second one we purchased, one of the pedals keeps falling off and now the one pedal has been lost bc it flew off and my son can’t find it. I’m frustrated bc my kids love these but in such a short time owning them we’ve had a few problems.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Lee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my 7 year old son's birthday! It took him about 20 or 30 minutes to get the hang of getting the trike to spin. This trike is a big hit in the neighborhood and my 4 year old daughter says she wants one for her birthday...and while she's almost to small to reach the pedals she scoots along on it nicely. One afternoon I hopped on to see what all of the fuss was about and I have to admit it's a pretty fun little thing...I'm just a little to tall, 5'4" to ride it.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and lots of thrills for kids!
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and we haven't had any over turns, although it seems like it would from the sudden change of direction. The kids have had a lot of thrills on it! Make sure the area is clear since there is no brake on it though.
customer_reviews.author: Joyful_Life

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6 year old for Christmas and it has easily become his favorite outdoor toy. A lot more sturdy and durable compared to your typical plastic big wheel and it gets great speed. My son loves making his spins. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: A good quality toy. Super fun!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 grandsons and they have so much fun with the Razor trike. it has been in use for two years and still going strong. I wish they made one a bigger one. The 10 year olds knees are hitting now. He still keeps riding it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M. Vandyke

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old grandson loves this bike. He’s a tall boy so think twice if this gift is for someone short. Their legs won’t reach the petals. Everyone in the his neighborhood is buying these for their kids. It is so much fun. Goes quite fast I think it’s really for 4 year olds or older
customer_reviews.author: msualum

customer_reviews.title: 8 yr old loves it..
customer_reviews.text: However he is 4'10" and his legs can reach...his 4 yr old brother, who is tall for four years old, can not reach pedals. I say this because there has been varying reviews and I had hoped 4 yr old was 'long' enough' to ride one also but his feet are about 3" shy of reaching pedals. Other than all that...it is very cool.
customer_reviews.author: MAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great for boys and girls
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, ages 8-12, and a girl pink as well. All love it. Even rode out in this extreme weather sliding on the ice!! They love how it spins, and slides. The wheels are durable, but I might need to order another pair because boys are tough! Assembling was quite easy and the instructions were not that difficult, about 30 mins each bike.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Castles

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble and kids love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much took all over 10 minutes to get this together. Kids have a blast on this, one small item is this thing can really get going and stopping can be an issue on hills for smaller kids. Just keep the feet on the big wheel!
customer_reviews.author: MNPilot

customer_reviews.title: They are sturdy and a lot of fun
customer_reviews.text: We use these every year for a charity trike race and work, where adults ride them. Many are over the 160 lb limit. They are sturdy and a lot of fun. After we race, we donate to children's charities and the kids are always very happy and seem to enjoy them as well!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Kos

customer_reviews.title: Just keep the bolts tightened
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids love it. Just keep an eye on the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Nice big-wheel for elementary age
customer_reviews.text: This is great toy! I really wanted to get big wheels for my boys, but they all seemed small and babyish. This offers my 7yr old boys a fun big-wheel experience made for their size. My 10 yr old enjoys riding it too. The seat does not adjust, but has plenty of room. If the kids are riding slowly & straight it will go like a regular trike, but some speed or quick turn of the wheel will make them spin. Really neat, but need clear driveway or other open space to play safely.
customer_reviews.author: KMkm

customer_reviews.title: This is a lot of fun for our rambunctious almost 6 year old
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot of fun for our rambunctious almost 6 year old. In the past we owned two of the red caster rip riders. I think we prefer them because they had a brake but this one is easily stopped either by locking his feet to stop the pedals or by dragging his feet on the pavement.
customer_reviews.author: BusyMommy

customer_reviews.title: So much fun! I'm a 35 yr old woman and I ...
customer_reviews.text: *Updated review.... After having this for almost a year, the color has faded quite a bit. We mostly keep it on the garage, but there have been plenty of days where it stayed out in the elements. The color should have lasted longer, otherwise the trike is still in great shape and still so much fun! So much fun! I'm a 35 yr old woman and I love to ride this. It's a little small for me. of course, but I still have fun on it. My kids love it! Buy one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Luca

customer_reviews.title: 360 turns.
customer_reviews.text: 2 grandsons. Bought one of these trikes many yrs ago. First grandson rode it so much that he wore it out. Along came second grandson and he wanted one also. Both have had many hrs of fun with trike. This one is so much better than just a big wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy, where's the adult version
customer_reviews.text: Man, the kids love them. I'm not sure how long the front wheel will last but they have fun on these things like crazy. Can't wait till it warms up so they can get outside and play with them. Do not let you kids in the street on these things as they are low to the ground and cars can't see them. Best for garages and open driveways. Be careful and make sure the kids don't try and put their feet down. We've gone through one pair of shoes already lol. Fun item, totally wish they had a grown up version...
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Hill

customer_reviews.title: Super cool, but too big for my 5 yr old right now
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews and ages of kids using this trike, I thought it would be a great birthday present for my 5 year old. He was really excited...and then a bit disappointed because he could not reach the pedals :( He had to scoot his butt about 6 inches forward to reach them. The seat is not adjustable. So we shove a pillow behind him for now, but it will be a lot of fun when it fits him better! He is average height (42 inches) so maybe a taller 5 yr old would be OK.
customer_reviews.author: Tlyle17

customer_reviews.title: Best birthday gift EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my friend's son's 5th birthday. It's awesome!!! Assembly was done in about 10 minutes and was a breeze (all required tools are included). The spinning is super cool and he was completely surprised and impressed. I did paint the frame neon green with a sparkle green coat on top to make it look cooler. I thought the look was kind of bleh, plus his favorite color is green, so I am the best Aunt ever! He will no longer ride his other bikes because this one is his favorite and it does tricks. Size wise I think he will be able to use it until he's about 10.
customer_reviews.author: CountryKracker

customer_reviews.title: Use on smooth surfaces avoid tipping, and there are no brakes.
customer_reviews.text: My six year old grandson loves this! I almost got an adult size because he is tall for his age; but so glad I got this one. He’ll still have room to grow; and now I see that the adult size would have been way too big. Helmet and supervision is a good idea; but he did great right away and I don’t live on a busy street. Very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Healey

customer_reviews.title: Super fun bike
customer_reviews.text: Both my kids love this. They are 6 & 9. They have a blast riding up and down our long driveway. Worth the money and has gotten the kids outside to play during quarantine
customer_reviews.author: L. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: The kids LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves it! He "test drove" his friend's bike and he wanted his own. After we bought his it seems everyone on the street has one. I was quite surprised at what I received. I had found one in the "used" section and it was $25 cheaper than the "brand new" ones. I figured the boys were going to wear it out so I got the used one. When it arrived it was still in plastic, had the original tags on it and had no wear on the wheels. It was a brand new bike. So...not only do all the kids love these but I got a bonus price. Thanks, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Salem in Texas

customer_reviews.title: great fun
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 6yr old grandson. Needed to put blocks on the wheels and pillows behind my 4 yr old grandsons. They all loved them once they figured them out. The spinning casters were a new concept for them. Definitely need the helmets, knee, and elbow pads for safety. The little guys took a few tumbles. These should fit them for many years of fun. We have a circular asphalt driveway and parking area that was perfect even with a slight hill. The trikes seem well built and sturdy. They were easy to put together. I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Gardendog

customer_reviews.title: Fun ride for older kids
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old son got for Christmas and says it's amazing to ride. It was fairly easy for my husband to put together (15 minutes). We are waiting for the snow to melt so he can ride outside! (So far he's been zooming around the house with it due to Christmas snow storm).
customer_reviews.author: Mom from Boston

customer_reviews.title: Spinning donuts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old grandson. I watched him open it today and take it for s spin back and forth up and down the driveway. Oh how he loves to get up a good speed, then do quick donuts on the pavement.
customer_reviews.author: Kar-Bear

customer_reviews.title: My son Christmas gift this bike is so much fun. He rode it in the snow and it ...
customer_reviews.text: My son Christmas gift this bike is so much fun. He rode it in the snow and it was so much fun for him. Sits low in the ground so not that worried about him flying off when it does the 360 turns. No breaks bit he has managed to do just fine. He does wear protective gear. Easy to assemble and so much fun
customer_reviews.author: Dkhill

customer_reviews.title: Kid's love it!
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike! Providing a lot of fun for the kids. Performs very well. Would purchase another. Strong frame! High quality parts. Assembly was slightly tricky at times, but nothing that wasn't easily overcome.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome three wheeler!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build. A very sturdy and durable bike. I am a full grown adult and still enjoy taking turns with my 6 year old on this bike, it’s fun and has great 360 features. A fair caution for beginners, it does turn really sharp and quick so make sure to ride slow until your comfortable controlling it. Overall, it’s an excellent quality bike and would suggest it!
customer_reviews.author: Monay Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH FUN!!!
customer_reviews.text: This little bike has been so much fun!!!! I got it for my grandson but my 22 year old has had a blast with it. Note: there are no brakes. But that is what makes it so exciting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My 61/2 yr old grandson loves this. I told him it goes really quick and to be carful. He wears his helmet and loves the spins it does. Great low bike
customer_reviews.author: J don

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little toy. It’s very solid and stable. Assembly took about 5min and is simply installing front wheel assembly, connecting seat frame and seat. Kids are 7 and 9 and biggest is 54”, still fits them easily.
customer_reviews.author: RJW

customer_reviews.title: Great bikes for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Best buy We have made for our boy & girl They love them and are fun also. Easy to put together we got the blue ones.
customer_reviews.author: Luz Machado

customer_reviews.title: TEN STARS!
customer_reviews.text: I have an eight-year-old grandson who rode his toddler big-wheel into the ground for years after he was too big, because he just loved it. This was the best Christmas present ever, and that's not an exageration. The Rip-Rider feels very well made (heavy metal construction), and the kid just LOVES it - he was spinning circles in the driveway laughing hysterically Christmas afternoon, and we can't get him off of it. It's big enough that he'll get several years of fun. I'm the favorite grandma now! lol
customer_reviews.author: NanaSarah

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: We are all fighting to ride this!!!! Everyone of my children ( ages 2,7,11) are on this non stop since we bought it and I have to admit that when they were at school I had a 360 spinning great time on it myself. I am jealous we didn't have these when I was a kid but they bring back great big wheel memories . All children should have this and if it is possible to order one slightly larger for moms I would be the first to buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Audrey

customer_reviews.title: New generation tricycle
customer_reviews.text: This was the best birthday gift I could of got my son! He just turn 5 and he got the hang of it within 15min. Now my daughter who is 8 wants one! The quality was great, everything I got was as pictured. Kids are taking turns for hours, better then store bought tricycles!
customer_reviews.author: Lupita Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy that has had daily!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our 10 year old son's birthday. He is a good sized boy and has gotten a lot of use with this toy over the last (almost) 3 months. Took about 20 minutes to put together. It's held up great with daily use. Our neighbors' grandson was so intrigued, he talked them into purchasing one as well!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bates

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and entertaining toy!
customer_reviews.text: It is great quality. It has handled 3 crazy boys doing their best to demolish it. It has managed to keep them all entertained as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun for 5 year old!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves this ride! It’s so much fun, lots of spinning and thrills. I assembled it myself (mom) in 20 mins. All the tools are provided and instructions are easy. It’s sturdy and a solid toy, Razor never disappoints.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii prime member

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my neighbors little girl (4). Dude, she loves this thing. Teach them to hold on to the handle no matter what and they will not fall off when spinning. This is a great product and is holding up while kept outside.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Andrews

customer_reviews.title: they are lots of fun for the kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4, one each for my 4 boys, they are extremely rough on toys, but these have lasted almost 2 years with minimal repair. The rear caster wheels will eventually start disintegrating, and one of them had the pedals break free of the front wheel. The rear caster wheels are available on Amazon, but I am having a hard time finding the front wheel. Overall, they are lots of fun for the kids!
customer_reviews.author: W E Torrance Jr

customer_reviews.title: He's loved these trikes since we first found them for him ...
customer_reviews.text: My son still loves this, same with his siblings. He can't ride a 2 wheel bike. He's 5 feet tall. Barely fits it now. But his smile is priceless when he's on it! He's loved these trikes since we first found them for him about 5 years ago. Back wheels do need replacing somewhat often. Maybe not so much now that we live on well paved streets.
customer_reviews.author: madhavadas

customer_reviews.title: Good for eight and twelve year old boys
customer_reviews.text: My twelve year old son has played with this often since last summer. We were concerned that he might be too old and wouldn't use it much but he still enjoys it. He loves it so much that it inspired his eight year old cousin to get one and they both really enjoy riding them together.
customer_reviews.author: Charlien

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike
customer_reviews.text: All of the kids in my neighborhood argue over who can use this first! From 3-10, great bike. The wheels are very durable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kelter

customer_reviews.title: Razor trike for bigger kids
customer_reviews.text: My son, 9, rode this at a friend's house and loved it. Got it for him, now can't get him off it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Warren

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Fun trike! My son loves it. We bought this one instead of the one with the scraper thing on the side, I didnt want marks all over the driveway
customer_reviews.author: JAM2000

customer_reviews.title: So fun I want one!
customer_reviews.text: This trike is too cool. My 6 year old can barely reach he pedals but she’s zooming around having fun. My husband and I both tried it out- looking ridiculous with our knees out to the side and we are definitely going to buy adult versions!
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy Rose

customer_reviews.title: This is a really fun riding toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun riding toy. It was easy to put together and we were playing on it in about 10 minutes. Bought it for the grandchildren but we all had to try it out. It was strong enough to hold up all of the adults and perfect for the kids. They get it out everytime we are outside and take turns with it. No one wants to give it up when it is their turn. You do have to have a good area to ride it, but if you do then it is all fun.
customer_reviews.author: Jayden Miller

customer_reviews.title: Super fun!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! My 4 and 6 year olds can manage it but still have room to grow. They love it, I should have bought two on account of them fighting over it non stop! Great quality and super easy to assemble. Took my husband fifteen minutes with out reading instructions. The casters work great and they drift all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: MamaHen

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great way to get hum iutside and active
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this all the time! It’s a great way to get hum iutside and active! The only slight problem I have with it is the fact that the scooter drifts by itself a lot. This makes it hard to steer in a straight line. I would keep this in mind before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: HP

customer_reviews.title: Kids love 'em!
customer_reviews.text: My boy really seemed to love this when he first got it, but I think his grandmother may have said something to discourage him from using it. She has a way of doing that. He really loved it when he first got it, and he rode it every day. I am afraid he is now about too big for it, being a husky 8-1/2 year old now. I wish I had known about these about a year sooner, so he would have gotten more use out of his.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan E. David

customer_reviews.title: Not for children over 7 and they should be a very small 7 year old.
customer_reviews.text: This product is definitely for a small child and not for any child over 7. There's no way their body and legs fit for the pedals. There is just not enough room there and the seat is not adjustable. The ad claims it's for someone up to 160 lbs. They would have to be a contortionist to fit into that small area. The legs would be under their chin and no way to pedal the trike.
customer_reviews.author: Karen F Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Kids like it
customer_reviews.text: Use thread locker on all the bolts and screws or the come lose and may become lost
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Awesome next generation Big Wheel!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 6 year old and he LOVES it! A lot like the original Big Wheel but the back two wheels are small and can rotate 360 degrees which adds more spin power to the whole bike. It's a super cool design and so nice that someone is still making this kind of bike/trike.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Z

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun toy, seems sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun toy, seems sturdy enough, however the seat is stationary with no way to adjust. This is a fairly big oversight as it can only really properly fit a child of one size only... they should fix this so that seat can slide fwd or back.
customer_reviews.author: laurie skaggs

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: The product came fast and was very easy to assemble . y kid loves riding it around the neighbor hood.
customer_reviews.author: Daman P. Cuzmanes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stunt trike for kids too big for a big-wheel!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! My 6 year old loves it! There's a bit of a learning curve though. I had to keep telling my daughter to keep her feet on the pedals while in mid-spin otherwise knees and feet get smacked into the bike due to the g-force. Once she figured it out, it's been the number one riding toy in the neigborhood. Super easy assembly too!
customer_reviews.author: Mhudson004

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and my four year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My four year old loves this! He'll be able to ride this a couple years before he out grows it. Wouldn't recommend for younger than four!
customer_reviews.author: Tripp

customer_reviews.title: These things are like an everlasting carnival ride for my 6 and 7 ...
customer_reviews.text: These things are like an everlasting carnival ride for my 6 and 7 year old children. Buyer beware though...they can be treacherous. We live in a culdesac so I feel comfortable with my kids cruising around. Both of my kids have had hours of fun and rumpus play on these bikes, but they do take a while to master gaining full control. They call them their, "crazy bikes" and that they are!
customer_reviews.author: Novato Mama

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A GREAT ITEM, NOW I NEED TO BUY 2 MORE ...
customer_reviews.text: MY SON IS 10 , I GOT THIS FOR HIS BIRTHDAY. HIS OLDER BROTHERS WERE THERE, AGES 27 AND 23 , THEY STOLE IT FROM HIM RAN OUTSIDE WITH IT. THEY WERE HOOTING AND LAUGHING SO HARD. WHAT A GREAT ITEM , NOW I NEED TO BUY 2 MORE FOR MY OLDER SONS. ITS A MUST HAVE , MY SON NORMALLY JUST STAYS IN HIS ROOM. HE GETS UP BEFORE SCHOOL AND HE IS ON IT, HE GETS OFF THE BUS AND HE IS RIGHT BACK ON IT. I WISH I HAD BOUGHT HIM ONE SOONER, GREAT TO SEE HIM OUTSIDE .
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Newland

customer_reviews.title: Grandsons love these
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for our grandchildren and they absolutely love them.
customer_reviews.author: gmaandlovingit

customer_reviews.title: 7 year old loves this thing!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old absolutely loves this thing. I assembled in about 15 mins and then took it for a test ride myself. I have rode this thing a few times and I weigh 200lbs+. Very well built and fun!
customer_reviews.author: Neonzer

customer_reviews.title: Are these even safe for children to use?
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are struggling with this. We ordered this for our boys and unless they are on a perfectly flat surface, these are a bit dangerous to ride... Because with any sort of little slope, the trike starts spinning and rolling backwards and there is no way a seven year old can peddle fast enough to go against the slope that is pulling him backward. We don't get it, we also don't get the stellar reviews. Unclear what is going on here.
customer_reviews.author: Lululu2013

customer_reviews.title: This bike is awesome. My son got it for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: This bike is awesome. My son got it for Christmas. He was so excited to use it. He loves riding it around the neighborhood and drifting.
customer_reviews.author: lb1780

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise mobile.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 6-year-old grandson and he likes it. He's still getting used to it but, all in all, it was a hit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burkett

customer_reviews.title: 1 year later almost 8 yo still loves!!!
customer_reviews.text: Soon to be 8 yo weighs 55 lbs after a year he still rides this with happiness and joy!
customer_reviews.author: TracyJ

customer_reviews.title: All the neighborhood kids love this!
customer_reviews.text: Great for many ages! My neighborhood has kids 4-12 and they all love this
customer_reviews.author: C. Crow

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart the first day of use
customer_reviews.text: Pedals came off the first day...2 bolts holding the front wheel on worked their way loose and also fell off...contacted Razor support and am being sent replacement parts. It's fun but obviously not durable.
customer_reviews.author: J Ruder

customer_reviews.title: great toy
customer_reviews.text: our Grandson loves this trike and he rides it every day
customer_reviews.author: karen peterson

customer_reviews.title: This is a very sturdy and fun trike
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy and fun trike. My son is 4 and he loves riding it. He was a little short for the peddles so we had a put a small pillow behind him in the seat. Other than that it is a great trike!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Neat little bike!
customer_reviews.text: We just purchased this set for our little guy for Christmas and it seems like great quality! Easy to assemble and sturdy. The instructions said it would take 15-20 minutes....plan for a little longer than that, but it's not due to difficulty. Only because the angles are funky and making sure each point is good and tight. Once the snow melts off we'll give it a shot!
customer_reviews.author: The Jackson Fam

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We bought it for our 10 year old son and he found that it was too small. We returned it for an upgrade. Good quality, too small for him.
customer_reviews.author: Todd K

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: This razor bike is pretty awesome. I bought it for my boys who are 5 & 3 yrs old. I can fit on it myself n was able to test it out. Needless to say I had a lot of fun on it. Lol. Might be a little too advanced for a 3 yr old.
customer_reviews.author: kerker

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! Just turned 6. He can just reach the pedals and the handles bars.
customer_reviews.author: SheLovesThePages

customer_reviews.title: just make sure your kids have room to let loose and have fun.
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old grandson loves this bike, he can make it turn and spin all over the place. This was the hit gift of his Christmas, I highly suggest this gift, just make sure your kids have room to let loose and have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Peetsie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for kids 6-10yrs old
customer_reviews.text: Absolute blast!! Wish the seat was adjustable for bigger "kids"! ;-) Too small for anyone close to 5ft or taller, but my 8yr old son loves it!! Very well constructed. Highly recommended for kids 6-10yrs old.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great trike
customer_reviews.text: Overall great bike. My 10 year old couldn’t ride it though. He was too big. He wouldn’t be able to ride it at 9. I think this fits best from 6-8yrs old.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Ann

customer_reviews.title: Son likes it enough.
customer_reviews.text: The product is ok, but a week after I bought it here for almost a hundred, I found it at Walmart for $40.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: the way things should be made
customer_reviews.text: Solid.....easy to assemble. This is the second one I buy.... very, very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome even for older kids!
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE this thing. It holds my full sized 12 year old and my 10 year old (separately). They still play with it after months. The turning radius is so good that they can play inside my 2-car garage on rainy days.
customer_reviews.author: ECOrlando22

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves his bike. Doesn't want to wear his helmet but understands why he most after tumble to the ground
customer_reviews.author: penny Copeland

product_meta.title: Razor RipRider 360 Caster Trike
feature_bullets: Dual inclined casters allow resistance-free drifting and spinning action
Features MX-style handlebar with rubber grips, double crown fork design, and welded steel frame and fork
Hi-Impact, front wheel with flat-free tire
Rugged steel construction for endless play!

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
